content:
To help you block out the time slot and avoid scheduling conflicts, I recommend setting a recurring event on your calendar. Here's how you can do it:

**Digital Calendar Method:**

1. Open your digital calendar (Google Calendar, Apple Calendar, Outlook, etc.).
2. Create a new event titled "Blocked Time - Online Meeting" (or a name that works for you).
3. Set the start time to 2:00 PM and the end time to 3:30 PM.
4. Make it a recurring event by selecting "Repeat" or "Recurrence" and choosing "Every Tuesday and Thursday" (or specify the exact dates you want to block).
5. Set the reminder to "None" or a low-priority reminder, as you don't need to be reminded of this blocked time.

**Physical Planner or Paper Calendar Method:**

1. Open your physical planner or paper calendar.
2. Write "Blocked Time - Online Meeting" (or a name that works for you) on every Tuesday and Thursday from 2:00 PM to 3:30 PM.
3. Use a highlighter or a colored pen to mark the time slot, so it stands out.

By doing this, you'll have a visual reminder to avoid scheduling anything else during this time slot. You can also set reminders or notifications if you want to be extra cautious.

Remember to review your schedule regularly to ensure you haven't accidentally scheduled anything during this blocked time.
